verses.verse: Ephraim<WH669> feedeth<WH7462> on wind<WH7307>, and followeth<WH7291> after the east wind<WH6921>: he daily<WH3117> increaseth<WH7235> lies<WH3577> and desolation<WH7701>; and they do make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with the Assyrians<WH804>, and oil<WH8081> is carried<WH2986> into Egypt<WH4714>.

The LORD<WH3068> hath also a controversy<WH7379> with Judah<WH3063>, and will punish<WH6485> Jacob<WH3290> according to his ways<WH1870>; according to his doings<WH4611> will he recompense<WH7725> him. punish: Heb. visit upon
He took his brother<WH251> by the heel<WH6117> in the womb<WH990>, and by his strength<WH202> he had power<WH8280> with God<WH430>: had: Heb. was a prince, or, behaved himself princely

Yea, he had power<WH7786> over the angel<WH4397>, and prevailed<WH3201>: he wept<WH1058>, and made supplication<WH2603> unto him: he found<WH4672> him in Bethel<WH1008>, and there he spake<WH1696> with us;
Even the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>; the LORD<WH3068> is his memorial<WH2143>.
Therefore turn<WH7725> thou to thy God<WH430>: keep<WH8104> mercy<WH2617> and judgment<WH4941>, and wait<WH6960> on thy God<WH430> continually<WH8548>.
He is a merchant<WH3667>, the balances<WH3976> of deceit<WH4820> are in his hand<WH3027>: he loveth<WH157> to oppress<WH6231>. a merchant: or, Canaan oppress: or, deceive

And Ephraim<WH669> said<WH559>, Yet I am become rich<WH6238>, I have found me out<WH4672> substance<WH202>: in all my labours<WH3018> they shall find<WH4672> none iniquity<WH5771> in me that were sin<WH2399>. in all: or, all my labours suffice me not: he shall have punishment of iniquity in whom is sin that: Heb. which
And I that am the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> from the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> will yet make thee to dwell<WH3427> in tabernacles<WH168>, as in the days<WH3117> of the solemn feast<WH4150>.
I have also spoken<WH1696> by the prophets<WH5030>, and I have multiplied<WH7235> visions<WH2377>, and used similitudes<WH1819>, by the ministry<WH3027> of the prophets<WH5030>. ministry: Heb. hand

Is there iniquity<WH205> in Gilead<WH1568>? surely they are vanity<WH7723>: they sacrifice<WH2076> bullocks<WH7794> in Gilgal<WH1537>; yea, their altars<WH4196> are as heaps<WH1530> in the furrows<WH8525> of the fields<WH7704>.
And Jacob<WH3290> fled<WH1272> into the country<WH7704> of Syria<WH758>, and Israel<WH3478> served<WH5647> for a wife<WH802>, and for a wife<WH802> he kept<WH8104> sheep.
And by a prophet<WH5030> the LORD<WH3068> brought<WH5927> Israel<WH3478> out of Egypt<WH4714>, and by a prophet<WH5030> was he preserved<WH8104>.

Ephraim<WH669> provoked him to anger<WH3707> most bitterly<WH8563>: therefore shall he leave<WH5203> his blood<WH1818> upon him, and his reproach<WH2781> shall his Lord<WH113> return<WH7725> unto him. most: Heb. with bitternesses blood: Heb. bloods
